website_summaries.verdict: Durable, mid-priced ceramic bean grinder with 100 g capacity that creates coffee-shop-perfect cups at home or on the road.
pros: Parts are metal and glass, except for ceramic burrs
Larger mill than other models, but still easy to set up and use
The end result makes a delicious cold-brew coffee
cons: The nut that secures the handle could loosen while grinding and need to be re-tightened

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly what I had expected when I thought I was getting a Hario.
customer_reviews.text: I don't like the fact that you have to stop every few seconds to tighten the handle back down. I didn't realize when I ordered this that it wasn't a Hario, as they had this set up to come to the top of the page when you search for a Hario burr grinder. The grind does not seem very consistent, so I am constatntly adjusting it for my cold brew. I have not used a Hario, so I do not really know if you are better off with one of those or not. I just no my experience with this grinder has not been the greatest.
customer_reviews.author: Teamsr2k1

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than most. Probably because it loosens itself while ...
customer_reviews.text: Cheaper than most. Probably because it loosens itself while you use it. That can be fixed with Loc-tite if you're not worried about that sort of chemical being placed food adjacent. Another thing to consider if you're naive to manual grinders as I was before making this purchase... It takes about 15-20 minutes of fairly rapid grinding to make 50gm of coffee grounds (about a medium size French press pot's worth). I can't add that to my morning routine so this is now decorative or going to a thrift store. :(
customer_reviews.author: somebody

customer_reviews.title: Better than others in the same price range
customer_reviews.text: Solid upgrade from the "travel" style (javapresse etc.) manual grinders that are all over the place at roughly the same price point. As other reviewers have noted it's basically a Hario Skerton clone, the glass container is nice and spacious, but personally I just use the grounds right away. The additional silicone ring definitely adds stability when in use on a kitchen counter, and this is a big aid in getting the desired consistency. My only complaint is that the hopper tends to not feed into the burr in a regular fashion. This often results in me having to smack the top of the grinder to get beans to actually fall into the grinding area.
customer_reviews.author: Jern Dough

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this grinder once a day for 2 months now, and am completely satisfied with it. Only $18, and it comes with the stabilizer installed - much less expensive than the Hario.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Stabilizer makes a big difference!
customer_reviews.text: I already had a grinder that is identical but without a stabilizer. This one is way easier to grind and the results are more consistent. (Note: I've only used it with a medium-course grind setting.) As a bonus, you can use the plastic lid as a perch for the grinder when it's not attached to the glass jar. BTW, the threading of the included jar works with small-mouth Mason jar lids, but strangely the grinder itself won't screw onto a Mason jar.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: I can only attest to the quality of their customer service, which was excellent. I cannot attest to the quality of the product since, for reasons irrelevant to this review, I have not used it. When the grinder arrived without the stabilizing ring I contacted customer service and they promptly sent me a whole new part with the stabilizing ring assembled. So far I'm very happy with their customer service, when I get a chance to use the grinder I will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: pickyshopper

customer_reviews.title: Stabilizer Washer is Missing, But on It's Way
customer_reviews.text: Will return unless corrected. Update - reached out to seller outside the Amazon platform, since they don't offer a mechanism to address issues other than returning the product. Got a response within a day, and a small refund for time and trouble. Washer is supposed to be on its way.
customer_reviews.author: SeattleDean

customer_reviews.title: Very Manual Grinder
customer_reviews.text: I suppose it is exactly as described. I just didn't expect it to be so much work. And it's not so much the work that I mind, it just takes a really, really long time grinding to get an appreciable amount of coffee. Pros: it grinds coffee easy to clean Cons: plastic grinding teeth takes a long time to grind medium-course grinds are very inconsistent in size
customer_reviews.author: Joshua K. Knoechel

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FOR COLD BREW COFFEE
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, very well made. I use it specifically for cold brew coffee. Easy mechanical grind adjustment allows you to home in on the perfect grind for your purpose/taste. It takes a little time to grind but you do not get static electricity or grounds flying all over with this device vs electric grinders. Excellent consistency as far a grind size (fine to coarse). Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: PhiLo

customer_reviews.title: Return due to lower burr misaligned!!
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, I rated this grinder for 1 star. The lower burr was stuck on one side. I attached a photo to show the issue. This must be a defective one. Can't even try to use it. Decided to return it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: GLHF

customer_reviews.title: Love this little grinder!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great little grinder !! For one it is adjustable so you can get the grind that you want. I've seen reviews saying this is not so but it is , you just have to be smarter than the grinder. Second it is portable so it can go with you any where, making it easy to never be without your coffee your way!! No power needed so it can go camping with you too, one reason I went with this grinder, would buy again and will refer it to friends ... may even give as gifts come x-mas!!!
customer_reviews.author: jerry loves amazon

customer_reviews.title: Bargain Burr Grinder For Picky Coffee Drinkers
customer_reviews.text: My husband travels frequently. He roasts his own coffee beans and takes them along. It occurred to him one day that coffee at home tasted better due to the burr grinder we have at home. He purchased this grinder to take along, and he is very happy now that his brew is perfect. The grind is very consistent. Premium Ceramic Burr Manual Coffee Grinder. Large 100g Capacity Coffee Mill. For Espresso, Pour Over, French Press, and Turkish Coffee Brewing.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great manual coffee grinder
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little hand cranked coffee grinder. What will you do when the electricity goes out and you need to grind your coffee? This little baby will save the day. It's easy to use with its longer crank handle and adjustable ceramic burrs. I wish the threads on the bottom of the grinder assembly were pitched to fit canning jars. That's the only complaint I have with it.
customer_reviews.author: Java

customer_reviews.title: Operates as smoothly as a properly waxed mustache does with a fedora
customer_reviews.text: I live in a yurt that I constructed entirely out of repurposed wood where I primarily focus on growing my man bun. Retaining that singular focus can be tricky and nothing helps more than a properly prepared cup of my favorite locally sourced, organic coffee. Without a manual coffee grinder, it would be impossible for me to achieve the quality of grind that would live up to my ironically unique persona. Fortunately, this Premium Ceramic Burr operates as smoothly as a properly waxed mustache does with a fedora. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is well made and works well. It takes longer that I would like to grind beans but that's the drawback of all manual grinders. Adjusting the grind consistency is fairly intuitive and takes less than a minute. It's not as simple as moving a level or turning a knob but that makes the adjustment mechanism more mechanically sound, less likely to slip or break, and significantly improves repeatability.
customer_reviews.author: John Kilvik

customer_reviews.title: Efficient, economical,  and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. It took a few tries to get the right grind. But, now that I have it, I can leave it. I really appreciate the silicone sleeve. I don't think I could grind successfully without the added stability.
customer_reviews.author: Ericka K

customer_reviews.title: uneven creamic grinder
customer_reviews.text: I have read a review about the uneven grinder. Thought it may have been a defective one. But as soon as i saw mine. i noticed mine too was uneven. Cause ls very inconsistant grind for my coffee, which is often the case for cheap grinders.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The perfect hand-operated coffee grinder
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my soon-to-be father-in-law when he told me that his electric one was lost during a recent move. He has serious vision problems, so this was a perfect way for him to enjoy fresh ground coffee once again without the typical mess typically caused by most electric grinders.
customer_reviews.author: Mick W. McGuirk

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, this grinder leads to a great cup of coffee. My family makes two large French press pots of coffee each morning, and this grinder makes quick work of our morning coffee routine. My only small complaint is that the nut in top of the grinder tends to loosen while grinding, so you do need to periodically stop grinding and tighten it.
customer_reviews.author: mpa 64

customer_reviews.title: A grinder that works!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought several manual burr coffee grinders...on one, the adjusting screw failed-the plastic arm cracked ( I bought two it happened to both.) Another one had issues with holding the shaft in place so the bottom grinder wobbled grinding inconsistently. No problems now.
customer_reviews.author: sandymoos

customer_reviews.title: Same as the Hario Skerton for less money.
customer_reviews.text: This grinder works as well as our old Hario Skerton for less money. Said Skerton was "damaged by gravitational acceleration followed by inelastic deformation on impact with the kitchen floor." That is, my kid dropped the Skerton. Happily, everything appears to be interchangeable, so I now have some spare parts.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Little

customer_reviews.title: I've been using it a few times a week for a few months and it works great, especially after I got the coarseness setting tuned ...
customer_reviews.text: I use it to grind espresso roast for my Moka pot. I've been using it a few times a week for a few months and it works great, especially after I got the coarseness setting tuned in. It takes about five minutes for me to grind a two shots worth of beans - if you enjoy the process of making the coffee, not just the coffee, then this is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: I like most of the features of this manual coffee grinder
customer_reviews.text: I like most of the features of this manual coffee grinder. The only suggestion I'd recommend is that they add more heft/weight to the bottom of the receptacle jar because it's difficult to stabilize it while grinding the beans. I have to keep a death grip on the neck of the jar as I'm grinding but the results are worth it to me. Having complete control of the size of the grounds far outweighs this one negative feature to me!
customer_reviews.author: Anon Y

customer_reviews.title: Lacking build quality, and poor customer support
customer_reviews.text: The center cone was casted crooked marking a very inconsistent grind. It took me several hours to modify it to work properly after customer service said they would send a repkacement, but I never got it.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky77

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use grinder.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first coffee grinder I have used for my French press. The grinder is easy to use and easy to set the grind thickness. Seems fairly durable so far as I gone through 3 bags of coffee beans with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: J.H.

customer_reviews.title: Makes for a Fantastic Cup of Coffee
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Does a great job. Half the price of manual competitor. Also I no longer liked my electric Braun grinder. This makes a fantastic cup of coffee. Be prepared to use some elbow grease😊 It’s easy to crank but it will take many cranks to make a pot of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia W

customer_reviews.title: What a magnificent design!!
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought it couldn't get the grind fine enough to make a good espresso, but I just had to learn the adjustment mechanism and make sure there are no partially beans stuck in there while adjusting.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: This grinder is great. I use it for travel and in my ...
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is great. I use it for travel and in my office (not as loud as an electric grinder which bothers co-workers). Grind more than you need? Just use the included storage lid to seal it up. Easy to adjust grind size. May get another for my second office and one for home.
customer_reviews.author: Scotsman

customer_reviews.title: Misalignment
customer_reviews.text: Mine arrived with misaligned burrs exactly like the other reviews show. However, it did not come with a stabilizer (as far as I can see) like the product description claims. Pretty disappointed. I am unsure how the stabilizer will even fix the issue; it looks like the shaft assembly itself is misaligned.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon S. Norris

customer_reviews.title: Cute and functional
customer_reviews.text: This little grinder is just what I expected. It is cute and works very well. It does take a few minutes to grind the beans, but that is part of the coffee-making ritual. It is easy to clean, and seems sturdy. I might put a lock washer under the top nut, which seems to loosen a bit with use. I think for the price this is a great find. It arrived promptly and very well packaged. Seller communication was great. I will definitely recommend this to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Milarky

customer_reviews.title: Its okay
customer_reviews.text: For the $ it's okay. I get the grind how I want it. It comes loose, but is an easy fix. The beans dont fall into the grinder as easy as I would like.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: I had an electric burr grinder, but was looking ...
customer_reviews.text: I had an electric burr grinder, but was looking for a non-electric version. Those is what I wanted and it works as intended. I wish there is an easier way to determine/pick the size of the grind as it's really just trial and error. And once you find the grind level keeping it in that position can be tricky, especially when cleaning. So far, I've managed by removing the top knob, then the arm, and then I reattach the knob without the arm. It's a little fussy, but seems to work.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth P.

customer_reviews.title: coarse grinds my coffee bean for cold brew
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to use and does a good job of coarse grinding the coffee I use for making cold brew coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Eric W Wallstedt

customer_reviews.title: I like the mini workout!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fantastic! I actually enjoy grinding the beans, but if a little workout isnt your thing, dont get this one! Its not hard at all, but some people dont like the effort required in hand grinding. This is a wonderful product, and your coffee will taste fantastic. The rewards are worth the effort!
customer_reviews.author: M.P.

customer_reviews.title: ... you don't mind hand-grinding -- it can be rather tedious, but worth it and kind of zen in ...
customer_reviews.text: If you don't mind hand-grinding -- it can be rather tedious, but worth it and kind of zen in my opinion :) -- this is a great product. I love how the base of the grinder is detachable and has a lid so it turns into a storage vessel for the grounds if you want to grind a bunch at once. Handle is easy to turn, and built well so my knuckled don't hit anything while I'm turning it, and the resulting coffee tastes fabulous.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Roueche

customer_reviews.title: I like the simplicity of this grinder
customer_reviews.text: I like the simplicity of this grinder. It's easy to use and well made. It was tedious finding the size grind I wanted for my French Press. It would be helpful to have some kind of markings to indicate at least a couple of sizes. I had to take it apart half a dozen times before I found what I wanted. The cap nut that holds the crank on has a tendency to come loose several times during the grinding process. Overall I'm pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I'm enjoying using this coffee grinder. It is easy to use, easy to adjust the grind size and easy to clean. The quality is great. I love that it comes with the jar and separate lid, so I'll usually grind up enough for a couple of days and refrigerate the grounds.
customer_reviews.author: lady_cupcake

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder for french press coffee
customer_reviews.text: Great little grinder for french press coffee. You can grind to your own satisfaction. Electric grinders pulverize the beans and make french press coffee too bitter. We repurchased this a second time because of the addition of the lid, keeping the beans securely in the grinder while grinding.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not that great 🙁

customer_reviews.author: taz

customer_reviews.title: Ended up buying a different option
customer_reviews.text: Took ages to grind enough for even a single cup of coffee. I knew that this method of grinding was not fast but 10-20 minutes for one or two cups of coffee is ridiculous. Main screw on top came loose with every crank.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: it should taste great, right
customer_reviews.text: Maybe the extra effort of manually grinding the coffee makes it taste better--after investing that energy, it should taste great, right? Well, it actually does! Some magical alchemy creates the best coffee I've ever made at home: full of flavor and without a trace of bitterness, unless you count my regret at not having started doing this earlier in my coffee habit...
customer_reviews.author: Bru

customer_reviews.title: Easily assembled and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easily assembled and easy to use. once it is adjusted properly for you choice of grind, fine, coarse, etc. , the ground coffee is very nice and even. Works well with all whole bean coffees and yields espresso fine grind to French press coarse grind. Plan to gift this grinder. If you are looking for an inexpensive, non motorized coffee grinder, this is the one you want.
customer_reviews.author: yorktowne

customer_reviews.title: nice grinder
customer_reviews.text: Does a very good job of grinding and so quiet compared to my late powered grinder. It does take time so makes more of a ritual out of creating a cup of coffee. The side benefit is that I realized I was excercising my old shoulder injury which I don't do enough of.
customer_reviews.author: srj

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective
customer_reviews.text: Simple and easy to use. Took me a minute to figure out how to adjust the grind, but it is a simple adjustment after removing the handle. It does a good job for its intended purpose and appears to provide an even grind.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Michaels

customer_reviews.title: Great grind!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, much better grind vs. electric coffee bean grinder. Appears to be a solidly built product. Stabilizer was her (included) is a must!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J. Morris

customer_reviews.title: I really love this coffee bean grinder from Simple Kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I really love this coffee bean grinder from Simple Kitchen! After trying several electric grinders, I think manual grinding is the first step to the best cup of coffee possible. I made my first cup this morning and it was excellent! The ceramic burrs are an added plus for the low cost, which enable you to get super-fine grounds if you want. The setting takes a bit of experimentation but not too much of a hassle. Everything seems quality built and should last a very long time. Great deal! I look forward to using this for many years to come. :)
customer_reviews.author: LARocker

customer_reviews.title: It operated easily, although it could really use something to prevent ...
customer_reviews.text: It's not fancy but it ground the beans well. It operated easily, although it could really use something to prevent the handle from spinning backwards (counterclockwise), which apparently can damage the burrs and that would only add a buck or two to the cost. We're quite satisfied with it overall.
customer_reviews.author: Catgirl

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, my only complaint would be that the grind ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, my only complaint would be that the grind is a little inconsistent... due to the nature of the conical grinder, and that it doesn't fit onto a bell jar. It has been fun grinding manually!
customer_reviews.author: Ashly Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Time Consuming
customer_reviews.text: This grinds quite slowly, but it gives my arms a nice little work out. I do like the little storage container and extra lid.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Best burr grinder... Period!
customer_reviews.text: This burr grinder performs better than my high end electric. The sturdy stainless handle is designed with good leverage for easy manual grinding. What impressed me the most is this is the first grinder I have found that can produce Turkish coffee ground as fine as flour! Espresso and drip grinds are very even. A truly great burr grinder at a fraction of the cost of lesser performing ones. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: Handsome addition to my coffee bar
customer_reviews.text: Nice even grind for my daily cuppa and not even too much work for a whole pot. I love that i don’t have to fear waking my children with the noise of an electric grinder!

customer_reviews.title: Comes with upgrade already!

customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Major design flaw- Handle broke within 1 month of purchase.
customer_reviews.text: We were thrilled when we bought this and still love the grind of the coffee. However, the knob on the handle is poorly designed (plastic knob connected to handle by a flimsy, inadequate rivet) and broke off completely within one month of use- roughly 20 uses. Disappointing, as orherwise this is a well designed product. Glad we held off buying extras as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Homa

customer_reviews.title: Handle broken after a year.
customer_reviews.text: After one year of use, the plastic handle thing broke off from the steel part. I tried applying different types of superglue to put it back together, which worked temporarily but then broke off again. Otherwise good product but now I can't use it.

customer_reviews.title: I enjoy this manual grinder immensely
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy this manual grinder immensely. I would have to say I was SOLD on the simplicity. I have just over a 10 year history with burr grinders. I can truly use this every day of the year at home or away. I can make French press at home and a pour over away. That is a beautiful thing!

customer_reviews.title: Great price and nicely packaged!

But according to the experts not adding heat to the coffee Bean produces a better brew. Nice product!

customer_reviews.title: Price, precision, and build quality...

customer_reviews.title: Awesome grinder
